snippet: A Lower East Side theater celebrates its centenary with an artistic director, Jay Wegman, who aims to shock and unsettle.
abstract: Jay Wegman, artistic director of Lower East Side theater Abrons Arts Center, plans to celebrate playhouse's centennial with cheeky tribute to Alice and Irene Lewisohn, founders of original theater at site; Abrons Arts Center's first theatrical commissioned work, Basil Twist play Sisters’ Follies: Between Two Worlds, follows Wegman’s tradition of offering outrageous and offbeat entertainment.
lead_paragraph: A Lower East Side theater celebrates its centenary with an artistic director, Jay Wegman, who aims to shock and unsettle.

headline.main: At 100, the Abrons Arts Center Revels in the Risky
headline.print_headline: A Nod to the Ghosts of the Founding Sisters
